intro: Eriospermum parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Eriospermum parvifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
